ggrecessions 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Recessions

recessions.Rd

The recessions table is published by NBER. The fetch_recessions function downloads the current table from NBER and formats it for use by other functions in this package.

recessions

fetch_recessions(url = NULL, quietly = FALSE)

Arguments

url

Char, the web location of the NBER machine-readable CSV file. The default, NULL, uses the most recently identified URL known to the package development team.
quietly

Logical, suppresses messages.

Format

A data frame with the following variables:

  • start_char, end_char: Easily readable labels for the beginning and end of the recession.

  • start_date, end_date: Recession Dates expressed in R datetime format, using the first day of the specified month.

  • ongoing: Logical. Whether or not the recession is ongoing as of the latest available NBER data.

Source

https://www.nber.org/data/cycles/cycle dates pasted.csv

Functions

  • fetch_recessions: Function for fetching recessions from NBER website

Examples

recessions <- fetch_recessions()

#> Successfully fetched from NBER

if (FALSE) {
  # package maintainers run:
  recessions <- fetch_recessions()
  usethis::use_data(recessions, overwrite = TRUE)
}
